newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH RAFINERSKA 1996 GROSS PROFIT CZK 1.17 BLN.
newsitem.headline: CZECH RAFINERSKA 1996 GROSS PROFIT CZK 1.17 BLN.

text.p: Czech refinery Ceska Rafinerska a.s. said on Thursday it posted an audited gross profit of 1.172 billion crowns for 1996, its first year of full operation.
A consortium of Royal Dutch/Shell, Du Pont de Nemours' unit Conoco, and Italy's Agip SpA holds 49 percent in the company.
A Rafinerska statement said the firm's total turnover reached 36.629 billion crowns.
It did not give further details on the 1996 results.

"The positive financial results in 1996 were achieved despite adverse conditions in the Czech fuels market in the spring and curtailed production as a result of a fire at the Litvinov refinery in November, " the statement said.
It added that profit in the first quarter of this year reached 427 million on sales of eight billion crowns.
Rafinerska was established with the merger of the refining operations of petrochemical firms Chemopetrol Group a.s. and Kaucuk Group a.s. under government-held holding company Unipetrol a.s..
The government subsequently sold a 49 percent stake to the foreign consortium at the end of 1995 for $173 million.
Chemopetrol and Kaucuk will also be merged into Unipetrol on July 1.
The holding company, which also controls fuel distributor Benzina a.s., should be listed on the Prague Stock Exchange in September.
A two-day fire at Rafinerska tanking terminal at Litvinov on November 23 last year interrupted production and supplies to Chemopetrol for several days.
A second fire just eight days later damaged Rafinerska's hydrocracking unit at the same site, forcing the company to shut it down for several weeks.
